data.Author: Daniel Izquierdo Cortazar <dicortazar@gmail.com>
data.message: Initial commit

data.Author: Daniel Izquierdo <dizquierdo@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Add module to deal with format and unification of data

Methods receive as entry a pandas.DataFrame.
Those return a new dataframe with some basic formating activity such as
adding, removing, filling and dates formating.

data.Author: Daniel Izquierdo <dizquierdo@bitergia.com>
data.message: Update documentation of main class in format.py

data.Author: Daniel Izquierdo <dizquierdo@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Add first version of the 'eventizing' tool

This helps to split items coming from Perceval into
the several events (open ticket, closed ticket, etc).

data.Author: Daniel Izquierdo <dizquierdo@bitergia.com>
data.message: Add two levels of events for Git activity: commit and file actions

data.Author: Daniel Izquierdo <dizquierdo@bitergia.com>
data.message: Add a first level of events for Gerrit activity

data.Author: Daniel Izquierdo <dizquierdo@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Add first enricher for pair programming activities

This module controls those authors and committers that are
different. If so, those commits are duplicated in the original
data frame with updated info about the original author.

This module works when the process within the organization
uses author and committer as a pair programming process.
For other cases such as identification of pair programming
in the log message or in the author name, further work
is needed.

This method helps to split a list of elements in a cell

data.message:
Add flag parser enricher to retrieve real authors from SCM logs

There are cases where commits are committed by bots. In some of those
cases it is necessary to parse the message left by developers.
An example of this could be the WebKit case where the author and
reviewer of the patch are identified.

data.Author: alpgarcia <alpgarcia@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Refactor project in modules by functionality

Project refactoring split the project in 3 modules, one per
functionality: eventize, enrichment, dataframe processing.

Tests have been updated to use these new modules.

Tests have been also updated to allow their execution from
any path. CSV data files for tests are now loaded taking
into account their absolute path, obtained from test file
real path at runtime.

data.Author: Daniel Izquierdo <dizquierdo@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Fix issue when 'eventizing' in Git

This change update the information found at the granularity
level 2 for a Git analysis.

This used to wrongly assigned
some specific 'eventized' fields to this granularity
when those should only work at the level 1.

Add config for flake8

Added setup.cfg file to allow to verify code style using flake8.

data.Author: alpgarcia <alpgarcia@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Add incremental updates support in Areas of Code

Now it is possible to build areas of code index incrementally by
running the builder with `inc=true` in the General section of
`.settings`.

To be able to build the index incrementally, we need to build
a custom `_id`, unique for each event we generate. We use the
following combination to achieve this:
Perceval_UUID + "_" + filepath + "_" + fileaction

Fixed a bug that didn't upload the last bunch of events. The
previous bunch was uploaded twice instead (it just overwrote
those items instead of uploading the new ones).

Some refactoring to get a clear view of the main loop.

Also adds support for merges filter by adding `files` field to
all items. This field will contain the number of files touched
by the given commit. This way we have this number available for
all file events generated for a commit.

Code compliant with PEP8.

data.Author: alpgarcia <alpgarcia@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Add write index creation if doesn't exist

When using ncremental mode from scratch index is now automatically
created if doesn't exist.

data.Author: Daniel Izquierdo <dizquierdo@bitergia.com>
data.message: Merge branch 'alpgarcia-incremental'

data.Author: alpgarcia <alpgarcia@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Fix error when enriching just the last Git commit

Apply method does not work when dealing with a single commit. For
some reason related to how we build our events DF, the call to
split filepath parts fails when use the incremental mode after
finishing collecting all items. At this point just the last item
should be retrieved again (as we use gte in incremental mode to
ensure we don't miss any commit), enriched and updated. However
apply method fails with:
`ValueError: Shape of passed values is (1, 2), indices imply
(1, 32)`

To avoid this, now we use pandas .str methods to split filepath.

Some minor formatting issues have been also fixed according to
PEP8.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Fix date parsing errors using grimoirelab-toolkit

Some dates in string format can be wrong, making 'dateutil' library
fail when parsing and converting them to 'datetime' objects.
The package 'grimoirelab-toolkit' provides functions which deals
with these errors parsing those dates with the best-effort possible.

This patch replaces the usage of 'dateutil' parser by 'str_to_datetime'
function available in 'grimoirelab-toolkit'.

Package dependencies were updated accordingly.

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
[setup] Reduce constraints on dependencies

Having numpy and scipy restricted caused some trouble with Python 3.7
(because there are no ready to install versions for those libraries
for Python 3.7), so I'm releasing their constraints on old versions.

Although six is not causing trouble, I'm also releasing its limit on
dependencies, preventing for the future.

Signed-off-by: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>

data.Author: Quan Zhou <quan@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[travis] Upgrade setuptools and pip

This code upgrades the setuptools and pip. This change
is needed to fix the CI tests that were failing due
to the following error:

```
Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 154, in save_modules
        yield saved
      File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 195, in setup_context
        yield
      File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 250, in run_setup
        _execfile(setup_script, ns)
      File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 44, in _execfile
        code = compile(script, filename, 'exec')
      File "/tmp/easy_install-wu9lgsxc/pandoc-2.0a4/setup.py", line 11
        error = f"pip is not installed, refer to <{url}> for instructions."
                                                                        ^
    SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```

Signed-off-by: Quan Zhou <quan@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[deps] Constraint numpy version to <= 1.18.3

The numpy deps is constrainted to <= 1.18.3 due to
a failure in building the docker image for grimoirelab
in docker, where the numpy version is 1.19.0rc1.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[CI] Migrate from Travis CI to GitHub Actions

Travis CI has brought a few changes in its plans
which is causing friction to the current workflow.

This commit removes the support of Travis CI and adds
the support of GitHub Actions as the new CI service.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>
